meanings.definition: To restrict the number of possible values of a quantity, especially to a discrete set of values.
meanings.sent1: She is quantising the data to make it easier to analyze.
meanings.sent2: The scientist is quantising the measurements to simplify the calculations.
meanings.sent3: By quantising the options, she made the decision-making process more straightforward.
meanings.sent4: Quantising the choices was like putting them into neat little boxes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher quantised the grading system to make it fair for all students.

meanings.definition: To approximate a continuous signal by a series of discrete values.
meanings.sent1: The computer is quantising the audio signal for better transmission.
meanings.sent2: Quantising the image helped reduce the file size without losing quality.
meanings.sent3: He joked that quantising his thoughts would make them easier to understand.
meanings.sent4: Quantising the music was like turning a smooth melody into distinct notes.
meanings.sent5: The artist quantised the colors in the painting to create a pixelated effect.
